name: Saint Barthélemy
description: Saint Barthélemy (officially Saint Barthélemy Island) is a French overseas collectivity in the Caribbean. Known for its exclusive luxury resorts, stunning beaches, and vibrant culture, it’s a haven for discerning travelers and yacht enthusiasts. The island boasts a unique blend of French and Caribbean influences, creating a sophisticated and laid-back atmosphere. It’s a volcanic island with a rugged interior, offering diverse landscapes from pristine coastlines to lush hillsides.

quickFacts.label: Capital
quickFacts.description: The island's main port and commercial center.
quickFacts.detail: Gustavia is a charming town with upscale boutiques, restaurants, and the impressive Governor's Palace.

quickFacts.label: Population
quickFacts.detail: The population is comprised of a mix of French and Caribbean residents.

quickFacts.label: Area
quickFacts.detail: It’s one of the smallest overseas departments of France.

quickFacts.label: Currency
quickFacts.description: The official currency of Saint Barthélemy.
quickFacts.detail: While Euro is used, US dollars are widely accepted.

quickFacts.label: Language
quickFacts.description: The primary languages spoken on the island.
quickFacts.detail: French is the official language, but English and Creole are widely spoken in tourist areas.

quickFacts.label: GDP
quickFacts.detail: Tourism is the dominant sector of the economy.

climateData.title: Tropical Climate
climateData.description: Saint Barthélemy enjoys a tropical climate with consistently warm temperatures year-round. The island experiences a distinct wet and dry season.

seasonalCharacteristics.name: Dry Season
seasonalCharacteristics.description: The dry season is characterized by sunny skies, low humidity, and minimal rainfall. It’s the most popular time to visit.

seasonalCharacteristics.name: Wet Season
seasonalCharacteristics.description: The wet season brings increased rainfall, particularly in the afternoons. However, showers are typically short-lived, and the sun often reappears.

naturalWonders.name: Colombier Beach
naturalWonders.description: Colombier Beach is a stunning crescent-shaped beach known for its dramatic cliffs and turquoise waters. It’s a popular spot for swimming, sunbathing, and snorkeling.
naturalWonders.detailedDescription: The beach is sheltered by towering cliffs, creating a tranquil atmosphere. The water is exceptionally clear, making it ideal for exploring the vibrant coral reefs just offshore.  The beach is accessible via a steep path or by boat.
viewingTips: Bring water shoes for the rocky shoreline
Arrive early to secure a good spot

naturalWonders.name: Pinel Island
naturalWonders.description: Pinel Island is a small, uninhabited island just off the coast of Saint Barthélemy. It’s a protected nature reserve and a haven for wildlife.
naturalWonders.detailedDescription: This idyllic island is covered in lush vegetation and offers pristine beaches. It’s a fantastic spot for birdwatching, nature walks, and enjoying the tranquility of the Caribbean.

biodiversityCategory.name: Coastal Ecosystems
biodiversityCategory.description: Saint Barthélemy’s coastal ecosystems are incredibly diverse, supporting a wide range of marine life and plant species. The coral reefs, seagrass beds, and mangrove forests are vital habitats.

statistics.details: Approximately 25% of the island’s coastline is covered by vibrant coral reefs.
The island boasts 5 square kilometers of mangrove forests, providing crucial nursery grounds for fish and other marine species.

notableSpecies.name: Humpback Whale
notableSpecies.significance: Migrates to the waters around Saint Barthélemy to breed and calve.

notableSpecies.name: Caribbean Coral
notableSpecies.significance: A key component of the island’s coral reef ecosystem.

ecosystemData.title: Coastal Ecosystems of Saint Barthélemy
ecosystemData.overview: Saint Barthélemy’s coastal ecosystems are a critical part of the island’s natural heritage. They provide essential habitat for a diverse range of species and contribute significantly to the island’s economy through tourism and fisheries.

biodiversityCategories.name: Coastal Ecosystems
biodiversityCategories.description: The diverse habitats along Saint Barthélemy’s coastline, including coral reefs, mangroves, seagrass beds, and sandy beaches.

statistics.details: The primary coral reef system covers approximately 10 square kilometers.

notableSpecies.name: Sea Turtle
notableSpecies.significance: Several species of sea turtles nest on the island’s beaches.

activities.title: Outdoor Activities
activities.description: Saint Barthélemy offers a wide range of outdoor activities for all interests and skill levels.

activityCategories.name: Hiking
activityCategories.description: Explore the island’s rugged interior and enjoy stunning views.

activities.name: Mount Odin Trail
activities.description: A challenging hike to the summit of Mount Odin, the island’s highest peak.

activities.name: L'Aurélia Trail
activities.description: A scenic trail through the rainforest, leading to a waterfall.

activityCategories.name: Water Sports
activityCategories.description: Enjoy the crystal-clear waters of the Caribbean Sea.

activities.name: Snorkeling
activities.description: Explore the vibrant coral reefs and marine life.

activities.name: Sailing
activities.description: Charter a yacht or take a sailing lesson.

clothing.winter: Layers, light jacket, sweater, rain gear
